title: Vue 'created' Lifecycle Hook

metadata.description: Learn about Vue 'created' Lifecycle Hook with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Vue Lifecycle Hooks Reference

Example
Using the
created
lifecycle hook to change the 'text' data property.
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      text: 'initial text'
    }
  },
  created() {
    this.text = 'The component is now created';
  }
}
Run Example »
Definition and Usage
The
created
lifecycle hook is called after the component is initialized.
Because the component is initialized, we can access properties inside the component instance such as
data
or
computed
, but we cannot access component DOM elements because they are not created until the
mounted
hook.

quiz.question: What is The component?
What is Because the component?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Because the component is 'initialized'.

summary: This tutorial covers Vue 'created' Lifecycle Hook concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Vue 'created' Lifecycle Hook effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Vue 'created' Lifecycle Hook and how to apply it in your projects.
